qas.question: During what decade did some British pubs provide "a pie and a pint"?
In what decade was the ploughman's lunch often consumed in pubs?
What decade saw the popularity of "chicken in a basket"?
What was "chicken in a basket" served in?
Along with chicken, what food was included in "chicken in a basket"?

context: In the <a0_0>1950s<a0_0/> some British pubs would offer "a pie and a pint", with hot individual steak and ale pies made easily on the premises by the proprietor's wife during the lunchtime opening hours. The ploughman's lunch became popular in the late <a1_0><a2_0>1960s<a2_0/><a1_0/>. In the late 1960s "chicken in a basket", a portion of roast chicken with <a4_0>chips<a4_0/>, served on a napkin, in <a3_0>a wicker basket<a3_0/> became popular due to its convenience.
